title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.Evidence.certainty` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Evidence.certainty` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `Evidence.certainty` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `Evidence.certainty` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `Evidence.certainty` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4B: `Evidence.certainty` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `Evidence.certainty` has a context of Evidence based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Evidence`.

short.value: Certainty or quality of the evidence

definition.value: Assessment of certainty, confidence in the estimates, or quality of the evidence.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Textual description of certainty.

requirements.value: Element `Evidence.certainty.description` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Evidence.certainty` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Evidence.certainty.description` has a context of Evidence based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Evidence`.
